definition: hourly worker/hourly job
clock/o'clock/time as measured in hours and minutes/bell/CL:架[jia4],座[zuo4]

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
work/worker/skill/profession/trade/craft/labor

sentences.english: It’s no longer required of you to work for the rest of your life to get paid by the hour, on the hour.
sentences.chinese: 你不會再被要求在你的餘生打鐘點工。

sentences.english: Wang run early in the city, she did four households part-time one day.
sentences.chinese: 王小早奔波在城市裏，她一天做四戶人家的鐘點工。

sentences.english: I thought of Lylian, the hour maid hired by my parents.
sentences.chinese: 我還想到了莉蓮，我父母僱的鐘點工。

sentences.english: I also thought about Lillian, our parents' part-time maid.
sentences.chinese: 我還想到了莉蓮，我父母僱的鐘點工。

sentences.english: To treat an illness to the father, she makes the hour labor to make money.
sentences.chinese: 爲了給父親治病，她做鐘點工賺錢。

sentences.english: Online hourly professionals are becoming a newly emerging job, the Daily Business reported.
sentences.chinese: 《每日商報》報道，網絡鐘點工正成爲一種新興職業。

sentences.english: Demand has the market, and I at a loose end, then the plan does hour work.
sentences.chinese: 有需求就有市場，而我正閒着，於是打算做鐘點工。

sentences.english: Ask the hour maid servant to ASH the dirt off the floor.
sentences.chinese: 叫那個女鐘點工把地板上的污垢擦掉。

sentences.english: But if we had a maid to clean the windows, it would be much better.
sentences.chinese: 但是如果有個鐘點工來擦玻璃就好多了。

definition: lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
needlework/sewing
Please do as you wish!/You are welcome to do whatever you like!/Please make yourself at home.
please excuse me for not complying/to politely decline
see 串門|串门[chuan4 men2]
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: reckless/extremely daring
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
to whisper to one another's ear
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
men and women should not touch hands when they give or receive things (citation, from Mencius)
pinyin: nan2 nu:3 shou4 shou4 bu4 qin1

definition: marriage by capture/bride kidnapping
to force sb to buy or sell/to trade using coercion
to make fun of/to seek diversion
it's nothing personal (idiom)
